Derp, thought last comment didn't get through.
@gigas232, this is also a common problem, it usually happens when you try to run BioShock in Windows 7 or Windows 8.  Try installing DirectX 9, that usually solves it! ;-)
@lotster dumb fuck, DX11 ships with Win8.
@MAA11792, yes. Obviously. AND BIOSHOCK DOESN'T USE DX11.  Go check your facts. Google it, like normal people do, before proving their idiocy through verbal diarrhea.

@MAA11792, yes, OBVIOUSLY.  However, a quick Google shows results on Microsoft's forums indicating that some games designed for DirectX 9 won't run on DirectX 10 or 11, having problems such as black screens.  The solution proposed by Microsoft professionals is to install DX9 alongside DX10 or 11.  I have used this solution myself, because many of my games don't run in DX10 or 11.  So, @MAA11792, before shooting off your mouth, do a quick Google.  It helps you to not prove your idiocy through verbal diarrhea.  Now go play with the other kiddies and leave us adults to talk intelligently without insulting one another.
